title: Calories in a Yellow Bell Pepper
meta_description: Learn calories in yellow bell pepper (one medium), plus carbs, fiber, vitamins, full nutrition facts, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
h1: Calories in a Yellow Bell Pepper
assumptions: Medium size (~119 g), raw, without stem or seeds; values based on USDA data.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by size, ripeness, growing conditions, and preparation; check labels or apps for specifics.

quick_answer.text: One medium yellow bell pepper provides ~25 kcal, mostly from carbs with good vitamin C.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one yellow bell pepper?
faqs.a: About 25 kcal for a medium raw yellow bell pepper.

faqs.q: Are yellow bell peppers low carb?
faqs.a: Yes, ~6 g carbs per medium, with 2.1 g fiber and natural sugars.

faqs.q: What's the protein in yellow bell pepper?
faqs.a: Minimal at 1 g per medium pepper; it's not a protein source.

faqs.q: Do bell peppers have fat or cholesterol?
faqs.a: Very low fat (0.3 g) and 0 mg cholesterol per medium yellow bell pepper.

faqs.q: How does cooking affect calories in yellow bell pepper?
faqs.a: Raw is lowest; added oils increase calories, but roasting alone keeps it similar.
